thread.title: Tour and Event News: Arizona Light Show; Skiing in the Dolomites
thread.title_full: Tour and Event News: Arizona Light Show; Skiing in the Dolomites - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Tour and Event News: Arizona Light Show; Skiing in the Dolomites
text:
STABLE TOURS IN KENTUCKY’S HORSE COUNTRY
Race-goers at this month’s Breeders’ Cup World Championships in Lexington, Ky., will not only see thoroughbreds on the track but, in a new program, may visit them at their prestigious breeding stables. From Oct. 25 to 28, in the runup to the Breeders’ Cup Festival on Oct. 30 and 31, visitors can tour the horse farms near Keeneland Race Course, which is holding the Breeders’ Cup race for the first time. Four-hour tours visit veterinary clinics and horse estates such as Darby Dan and Runnymede Farms, where future contenders are sired (tickets, $65). The tours are just part of the spectacle surrounding the race, including a food truck competition called the Feeders’ Cup, bourbon tastings and art exhibitions.
